page.title: 15MONKLAND CANAL
page.content: The{Monkland Canal}was surveyed by {James Watt}the famous{Scottish {inventor}of the{steam engine.} The{canal}became an{important route in the area.There were{coal pits}along the{canal}and{barges}would pick up the{coal}and take it away to the {factories. In{1796}a disaster happened.The {canal}burst its banks.{Water}poured into the{works}of one of the{pits. There were{five people}working there at the time.{Three escaped}and{two {people died}and their bodies have never been found. As the{pits}closed the{canal}fell into{disrepair.}Now the{canal}is being cleaned from{Blair Road}to{Drumpellier It was{cleaned}by a{dredging machine which pumps out the mud. The{canal}is now{restocked with trout.
